--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Lady Hawk glared a frozen stare at ZArdus. She knew that she was 
outnumbered
> and overpowered. She'd let her gaurd down one to many times. Now 
was the
> time for the tough act. "Squizzy wanted credit for my expriments, I 
had to
> do to her before she did to me." She squirmed a little moire trying 
to get
> at least her wings uncramped. "I'm sure you'd have done the same if 
someone
> wanted to steal your technology."  Lady Hawk was playing on Zardus' 
logic to
> escape this situation. "I came to you alone and with technology 
that could
> help you in your goals." Logic dictated that she'd be stupid to 
challenge
> the alliance one on all. "Now that I've answered you would you 
release me
> and at least grant me the dignitty of walking on my own two feet?"
> 
> 
> ----- "But you have two wingssss to fly too... "Replied Najah, nd 
he asked
> t Zardus "Excusssss me Ssssir... if the birdie try to fly over the
> cage, can I kill her????"
> 
> Again Lady Hawk looked to logic for an answer. "I'm a hawk, of 
course I can
> fly" She was really feeling offended now.
> 
> 
> Zardus nods, "Of course. But she wont try to escape, not if she 
wants
> to live.", "Correct?"
> 
> Lady hawk thought the question was redundant. " Wher would I go?" 
She knew
> that at 100 percent she could probably outfly any member of the 
alliance.
> But with her injuries she'd either be caught or lead them back to 
Veratis.
> 
> 
>

the best

Repressor.
> > The bot takes a step back, out of Lady Hawk's reach, and aims a 
good sized
> > gun at her. Zardus looks back to Lady Hawk, "Now, what were you 
doing to
> > Squizzy?"
> > ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> > Havoc stops, nearing the flying portions of the Alliance base. 
For some
> > reason they had slowed, continuing ahead slowly. He activates his 
internal
> > computers, tapping into the computer of one of the shuttles.
> >
> > He nods, looking through the info he got back. The cargo section 
was a bit
> > too heavy for the shuttle carrying it, so they had to slow for 
now.
> Another
> > shuttle from the Iron Fist was on its way to soon help.
> >
